question: Post-devolution revenue deficit grant of Rs.6157 crore has been released by the central government for how many states?
explanation:
The Government of India has released Rs 6,157 crore as post-devolution revenue deficit grant to 14 states. This has been done as per the recommendations of the 15th Finance Commission.
The 14 states are Andhra Pradesh, Assam, Himachal Pradesh, Kerala, Manipur, Meghalaya, Mizoram, Nagaland, Punjab, Sikkim, Tamil Nadu, Tripura, Uttarakhand and West Bengal.
